intro: Ageratina jucunda, commonly known as the silverleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage with a fuzzy texture, and its small white or blue flowers bloom in clusters. Ageratina jucunda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes.
